title: Man shot himself, police say
content:
A Clifton man was jailed Sunday on multiple counts related to a shooting incident near a park adjacent to Rocky Mountain Elementary School on D¾ Road.
Andrew Cassi Baca, 18, allegedly shot himself in the leg while running away from police in the park, according to an arrest affidavit.
Deputies with the Mesa County Sheriff’s Office had spoken to Baca earlier that evening, and he told them he didn’t know anything about reports that shots had been fired in the area, the affidavit said.
Deputies were trying to identify the owners of two handguns that were found in Baca’s vehicle, but Baca told them he didn’t know, according to the affidavit.
A few hours later, Baca was treated at St. Mary’s Hospital for a gunshot wound to the leg. At first, Baca said he shot himself accidently while target shooting, but later said he did so while running away from authorities.
He was jailed on suspicion of tampering with physical evidence, prohibited use of a weapon, unlawfully carrying a concealed weapon, false reporting to authorities and disorderly conduct.
He was released from jail on a $5,000 cash bond.
During the incident, deputies recovered a loaded gun magazine from one of numerous teens who were pulled out of two vehicles, the affidavit said.
